key_insight: A multi-aspect, multi-agent system that combines image, text and symptom-level reasoning — backed by the new RESTOREx resource — can more precisely identify depressive symptoms expressed in memes than single-stream sentiment classifiers.
problem_solved: Detecting nuanced depressive symptoms in multimodal meme content (images + overlaid text) where traditional sentiment or single-modality models miss symptom-specific cues and context.
method: Assemble RESTOREx: a curated, symptom-annotated multimodal dataset of memes for depressive-symptom detection.
Multi-agent pipeline: specialized agents analyze visual cues, textual content, and clinical symptom indicators separately, then collaborate to produce symptom-level predictions.

Multi-aspect fusion and reasoning: combine agent outputs (and leverage large multimodal / language models for higher-level reasoning) to produce explainable symptom labels rather than just binary outcomes.
impact: Provides practitioners a dataset and an architectural blueprint for symptom-level, explainable depressive-symptom detection in memes — enabling more targeted monitoring, research, and responsible intervention systems in multimodal mental-health applications.

paper_title: MAMA-Memeia! Multi-Aspect Multi-Agent Collaboration for Depressive Symptoms Identification in Memes
paper_authors: Siddhant Agarwal, Adya Dhuler, Polly Ruhnke, Melvin Speisman, Md Shad Akhtar
